text: Who might be hiding their pain today behind a smile?
reflection: Ask the Lord to reveal someone in your life who needs hope. Start with a simple message: 'I've been thinking of you—how are you really?' Theophilus can help you continue from there.

text: Every soul is a door Christ knocks on.
reflection:
Visual post idea:
Image: A pair of empty slippers at a door.
Caption: 'Will you be His voice today?'
Call to action: 'Ask Theophilus how to start spiritual conversations.'

text: There is nothing colder than a Christian who does not seek to save others.
reflection: St. John Chrysostom once said this to stir sleeping hearts. Let your heart burn today—for one soul, even just one.
verse: St. John Chrysostom, Homily 20 on Acts

text: You might be one conversation away from changing someone’s eternity.
reflection: What if Christ wants to use your voice today? Ask Theophilus for the words to begin. He will guide you.

text: Let your light shine—not just on Sunday, but today.
reflection: A kind word. A question asked gently. A story shared. This is how Christ walks through us. Theophilus is ready to help.
Be there for someone. Listen without rushing. Let the conversation slow down enough for grace to slip in. If you're unsure how to guide it, ask Theophilus.

text: You are a living letter from Christ.
reflection: Your story matters. Share how God met you. Don’t underestimate what a single testimony can do. (See 2 Corinthians 3:3)

text: A prayer before a conversation can open more than mouths—it can open hearts.
reflection: Before you meet someone today, whisper a quiet prayer: 'Lord, speak through me.' Then trust. Theophilus can help if you get stuck.

text: Your friend doesn’t need a sermon. They need you to care.
reflection: Start small. Ask questions. Share gently. Let love lead the way, and Theophilus will help you make Christ known.

text: There are wounds only Christ can heal—but He sends us to carry the oil and wine.
reflection: Think of the Samaritan. Evangelism isn’t only words—it’s presence, compassion, action. Who needs you today?
Was today quieter than you hoped? Maybe that's space for an unexpected conversation. Stay open. Ask Theophilus how to recognize those moments.

text: Sometimes, the right question is more powerful than the perfect answer.
reflection: Don't fear being unprepared. Ask, listen, love. Theophilus will help you with the rest.
